parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
A breast-plate, corslet, cuirass. Of uncertain affinity; the chest, i.e. a corslet.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
A breast-plate, corslet, cuirass. Of uncertain affinity; the chest, i.e. a corslet.
Made of iron. From sideros; made of iron.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably akin to phaino through the idea of disclosure; a tone; by implication, an address, saying or language.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Feminine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A wing, pinion. From a derivative of petomai; a wing.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
Probably akin to phaino through the idea of disclosure; a tone; by implication, an address, saying or language.
A horse. Of uncertain affinity; a horse.
A chariot, vehicle. Probably from airo (as a particle of union) prefixed); a chariot (compare harmos).

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: Apparently a primary verb; which uses dremo drem'-o as alternate in certain tenses; to run or walk hastily.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
A war, battle, strife. From pelomai; warfare.
